snippet: Tzipi Livni, who lost the leadership of her centrist Kadima Party and her position atop the opposition, resigned from the Israeli Parliament on Tuesday but said that she was not quitting public life.
abstract: Tzipi Livni resigns from Israel's Parliament, following her loss of leadership in the centrist Kadima Party and her position as leader of the opposition; announces that she is not quitting public life; move comes as Israeli politicians prepare for elections. Photo (M)2
lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM -- Tzipi Livni, who recently lost the leadership of the centrist Kadima Party and her position as leader of the opposition, resigned from the Israeli Parliament on Tuesday but said that she was not quitting public life. ''The state of Israel is too dear to me to stop working for its interests,'' Ms. Livini told reporters before handing her letter of resignation to the speaker of the house.

headline.main: After Defeat, Livni Quits Parliament In Israel
